ci_support_linux_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- condaforge/linux-anvil-comp7
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- '2.7'

about.description: pySW4 is an open-source project dedicated to provide a Python framework for working with numerical simulations of seismic-wave propagation with SW4 in all phases of the task (preprocessing, post-processing and runtime visualization).
about.summary: Setup, run, post process, and visualize numerical simulations. Primarily SW4

about.description: pySW4 is an open-source project dedicated to provide a Python framework for working with numerical simulations of seismic-wave propagation with SW4 in all phases of the task (preprocessing, post-processing and runtime visualization).
about.summary: Setup, run, post process, and visualize numerical simulations. Primarily SW4

name: pysw4
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pySW4" %}
{% set version = "0.3.0" %}
{% set sha256 = "b14bb605da99ffb557fe1742914207beb876602bb69576b95fc1176304b6c58a" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  fn: {{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url: https://github.com/shaharkadmiel/pySW4/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  noarch: python
  number: 1
  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record record.txt
  entry_points:
    - pySW4-plot-image = pySW4.cli.plot_image:main
    - pySW4-create-plots = pySW4.cli.create_all_plots:main
    - png2mp4 = pySW4.cli.png2mp4:main

requirements:
  build:
    - python
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python
    - obspy >=1.0.3
    - numpy
    - scipy
    - matplotlib-base
    - pyproj
    - gdal 2.*

test:
  imports:
    - pySW4
  commands:
    - pySW4-plot-image --help
    - pySW4-create-plots --help
    - png2mp4 --help

about:
  home: https://github.com/shaharkadmiel/pySW4/
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: 'Setup, run, post process, and visualize numerical simulations. Primarily SW4'

  description: |
    pySW4 is an open-source project dedicated to provide a Python framework for working with numerical simulations of seismic-wave propagation with SW4 in all phases of the task (preprocessing, post-processing and runtime visualization).
  doc_url: http://shaharkadmiel.github.io/pySW4/
  dev_url: https://github.com/shaharkadmiel/pySW4/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - shaharkadmiel
    - megies
